missionProperties.missionInfo:
{-} Doors are locked. A hero can interact with a door ({K} or {I}) to open it. A Rebel figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: None).
{-} The mission progresses when a door to the Cantina or to the Junk Shop opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded and <color="red">R2-D2</color> is defeated.
missionProperties.startingObjective: Get into the Cantina. Get into the Junk Shop.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

This back alley area of Mos Eisley, though dangerous, holds some of the most knowledgeable contacts in the system, as well as old consoles used by smugglers to transfer information without meeting in person. In other words, the value is worth the risk.

All the same, you skulk through this alley with some caution, knowing that it’s not just the unsavory locals you need to be worrying about. Validating your concern, you hear a stormtrooper yell, "Freeze!" as a blaster bolt whizzes by your head. It seems that you aren't the only ones who discovered the value of information in this alley.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Deploy <color="red">R2-D2</color> (Loyal Astromech) to the red indicated space. Heroes control him as an ally.
{-} Doors are locked. A hero can interact with a door ({K} or {I}) to open it. A Rebel figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: None).
{-} The mission progresses when a door to the Cantina or to the Junk Shop opens.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded and <color="red">R2-D2</color> is defeated.

Through a cunning combination of battle prowess, technical ability, and simple street smarts, you have secured valuable information about the local Imperials. You run from the battle, eager to contact Command with this valuable new intel.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!

eventActions.mainText: Did you play this mission as part of the "Twin Shadows" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
It doesn’t matter how good the intel is, it won't help if you can't get out alive. The Imperial presence is just too strong, and you choose to make a strategic retreat, hoping to return later.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.

eventActions.mainText: Did you play this mission as part of the "Twin Shadows" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
Though your information gathering campaign was successful, the knowledge you uncovered was quite disturbing. You found that the Imperial presence on this planet was much stronger than you thought.

A particularly influential stormtrooper commander named Somos has been running surveillance and intimidation operations for months now, although no one seems to know the final goal of this campaign. You also discovered that the Imperial base of operations lies within the forbidding Jundland Wastes.

“It’s worse than you know,” your pilot tells you as you relay the information you gathered. “I’ve been working with the comm systems; that Star Destroyer is blocking everything moving out of the planet’ atmosphere. Our operatives here could have been signaling for help for months and we wouldn't have known a thing. Go check out that base; we need to get this sorted out now!”

{-} Each hero receives 3 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.
{-} The next active mission is “Canyon Run”.

Dejected after your failed attempt to gather information, you contact your pilot to see what he knows.

"Well, the situation isn’t good," he responds. "I don't know much, but I do know I can't get any information out. That Star Destroyer is blocking all signals going out of the planet’s atmosphere. Solo and any other Rebel operatives could have been calling for help for months, and we wouldn't have known."

"All I can tell you is I've been able to track some stormtrooper movement out in the Jundland Wastes. They may have a base out there. I know it’s a miserable place, but it may be our best bet."

{-} Each hero receives 2 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.
{-} The next active mission is “Canyon Run”.

{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

eventActions.shortText: Interrogate the informants. Get into the Junk Shop. (Intel gathered: &Intel&/4)

eventActions.theText:
{-} Doors are locked. A hero can interact with a door ({K} or {I}) to open it. A Rebel figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: None).
{-} Mission tokens represent informants. A hero can interact with an informant ({J} or {K}) to gather that informant’s intel.
{-} Heroes cannot interact with an informant if there is an Imperial figure within 3 spaces of that informant.
{-} The Rebels win when all intel has been gathered.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded and <color="red">R2-D2</color> is defeated.

eventActions.repositionText: Block access to informants while staying within 3 spaces of them.

eventActions.shortText: Get into the Cantina. Investigate the terminals. (Intel gathered: &Intel&/4)

{-} Heroes cannot interact with a terminal if there is an Imperial figure within 3 spaces of that terminal.
{-} The Rebels win when all intel has been gathered.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded and <color="red">R2-D2</color> is defeated.

eventActions.shortText: Interrogate the informants. Investigate the terminals. (Intel gathered: &Intel&/4)

eventActions.theText:
{-} Doors are locked. A hero can interact with a door ({K} or {I}) to open it. A Rebel figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: None).
{-} Mission tokens represent informants. A hero can interact with an informant ({J} or {K}) to gather that informant’s intel.
{-} A hero can interact with a terminal ({J} or {I}) to gather that terminal's intel.
{-} Heroes cannot interact with a terminal or informant if there is an Imperial figure within 3 spaces of that terminal or informant.
{-} The Rebels win when all intel has been gathered.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded and <color="red">R2-D2</color> is defeated.

eventActions.repositionText: Block access to informants and terminals while staying within 3 spaces of them.

events.eventText: Saska simply stops and laughs at the Imperials intent on interfering. “What do they think they're doing?” she says with a sarcastic tone. “This is my hometown; I know my way around!” R2-D2 beeps in seeming agreement as she pulls out her blaster in one hand and an unknown, but potent-looking device in the other.

events.eventName: End of Mission - Rebels lose Rounds
events.eventText:
It doesn’t matter how good the intel is, it won't help if you can't get out alive. The Imperial presence is just too strong, and you choose to make a strategic retreat, hoping to return later.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.

{-} Doors are locked. A hero can interact with a door ({K} or {I}) to open it. A Rebel figure can attack a door (Health: 5, Defense: None).

eventActions.mainText:
You try to open the door.

{-} Test {K} or {I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the door, then discard all strain tokens on the door. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
The door won't budge. You need to keep trying.

{-} Place 1 strain token on the door for each {B} result gained.

eventActions.mainText:
You try to open the door.

{-} Test {K} or {I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the door, then discard all strain tokens on the door. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:

{-} Place 1 strain token on the door for each {B} result gained.

eventActions.mainText:
You sit down at Amrekk's table, hoping to either persuade or intimidate him into answering your questions.

{-} Test {K} or {J}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on Amrekk, then discard all strain tokens on the Amrekk. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
Amrekk does not want to talk. You need to keep trying.

{-} Place 1 strain token on Amrekk for each {B} result gained.

events.eventText: "The Tuskens are in uproar", Amrekk growls after some prodding. "The Empire has established an outpost in the Jundland Wastes, blocking their traditional migration routes. They say that some Tusken tribes have allied themselves with the Imps. Now go bother someone else."

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
Amrekk, a Weequay veterinarian specialized on Banthas, is trying to enjoy his drink here despite the presence of the Imperial soldiers.

{-} A hero can interact with an informant ({J} or {K}) to gather that informant’s intel.

eventActions.mainText:
You approach the bar and hope that you can get some info out of Sienn.

{-} Test {K} or {J}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on Sienn, then discard all strain tokens on the Sienn. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
Sienn keeps glancing your weapons and the dead soldiers. You need to keep trying.

{-} Place 1 strain token on Sienn for each {B} result gained.

events.eventText:
"Yeah, I've heard a few things", Sienn finally admits in a low voice, trying not to attract too much attention. "They are led by a bloke called Somos. Kayn Somos. Huge guy, almost bursting out of the Trooper armor. They say he is relentless, but also that his men are fiercely loyal to him. And he has the Emperor's attention."

She takes a step back. "That's all."

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
Sienn, an attractive Twi'lek woman, is tending the bar, glancing nervously at the Imperial soldiers.

{-} A hero can interact with an informant ({J} or {K}) to gather that informant’s intel.

eventActions.mainText:
You brush the dust from the terminal and try to acces its data.

{-} Test {J} or {I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the terminal, then discard all strain tokens on the terminal. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
The terminal is old and slow, leaving you frustrated. You need to keep trying.

{-} Place 1 strain token on the terminal for each {B} result gained.

events.eventText:
There is not a lot to go with, but you manage to scavenge some data concerning Imperial troop movements in the surroundings of Mos Eisley. Apparently, they have dealings with some of the black market sellers in the town.

Shortly after, the terminal shuts down, sparks flying out of the console.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
A dusty terminal sits in the far corner of the Junk Shop. It might contain useful data.

{-} A hero can interact with a terminal ({J} or {I}) to gather that terminal's intel.

eventActions.mainText:
You try to access the data without interrupting the process.

{-} Test {J} or {I}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the terminal, then discard all strain tokens on the terminal. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
Somebody knew what they did when encrypting the data. You need to keep trying.

{-} Place 1 strain token on the terminal for each {B} result gained.

events.eventText:
You manage to gather some data about financial streams from the Mos Eisley black market. Some of those are tied to the Imperials, but it's impossible to identify details. Apparently, the Empire tried to influence Mos Eisley's economy through the back door.

Not long after that, the security protocols shut down the terminal for good.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
A terminal in the Junk Shop is humming softly, processing data. It might contain useful data.

{-} A hero can interact with a terminal ({J} or {I}) to gather that terminal's intel.

events.eventText: Loud commotion can be heard outside the Cantina and the Junk Shop. From one side of the alley, roaring Tusken Raiders storm in, shaking their gaffi sticks. At the same time, a gate on the other side of the road bursts open, and more forces join the fray.
Saska Teft receives the "Tech Goggles" Reward card.
The heroes receive 150 credits per hero.
